io.jeo.data

Class Handle<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.jeo.data.Handle<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Disposable, Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public abstract class Handle<T>
extends Object
implements Disposable
    Reference to a data object.

    A handle is a lightweight proxy to a data object meant to convey information about the object without necessarily having to load it. The resolve() method is used to obtain the underlying data object from the handle.

    Author:
    Justin Deoliveira, Boundless

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: Disposable
        Disposes the object.

        Unlike Closeable.close() this method does not throw IOException and implementations must ensure no exceptions are thrown from this method.

        Application code must always be sure to call this method on any implementing class. Implementing classes should handle multiple calls to this method.

        Specified by:
        close in interface Disposable
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
